articles.headline: Pence Is Trying to Control Republican Politics. Trump Aides Aren’t Happy.
articles.snippet: President Trump has not yet crafted a strategy for his involvement in the midterms. So his supremely disciplined running mate has stepped into the void.
articles.abstract: President Trump has not yet crafted a strategy for his involvement in the midterms. So his supremely disciplined running mate has stepped into the void.
articles.lead_paragraph: Representative Jeb Hensarling of Texas needed a favor: Before retiring, he wanted to anoint a local activist as his successor. Mr. Hensarling, a veteran conservative, reached out to President Trump for help, but the White House hesitated to intervene, according to a person familiar with the overture.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns, Jonathan Martin and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: In India, Facebook’s WhatsApp Plays Central Role in Elections
articles.snippet: Unlike Facebook and Instagram, WhatsApp has received little attention for its influence on voters. But in one Indian state, the messaging service became a prime election tool.
articles.abstract: Unlike Facebook and Instagram, WhatsApp has received little attention for its influence on voters. But in one Indian state, the messaging service became a prime election tool.
articles.lead_paragraph: MANGALORE, India — Waving a giant saffron flag, Pranav Bhat last week joined a political rally for Prime Minister Narendra Modi and India’s ruling party here in this sweltering port city on the southwest coast.

articles.headline: Iraqi Voters Strengthen Hand of Militia Leader Who Battled U.S.
articles.snippet: Moktada al-Sadr’s forces fought fiercely against American soldiers during the Iraq war. They were also responsible for atrocities against civilians.
articles.abstract: Moktada al-Sadr’s forces fought fiercely against American soldiers during the Iraq war. They were also responsible for atrocities against civilians.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD — Moktada al-Sadr, a firebrand militia leader whose forces once battled American troops in Iraq and were implicated in widespread atrocities against civilians, has emerged as the surprise front-runner in the Iraqi national elections, according to Iraqi election officials.
articles.byline: By Margaret Coker and Rick Gladstone

articles.headline: Waves of Gazans vs. Israeli Tear Gas and Bullets: Deadliest Mayhem in Years
articles.snippet: A lopsided fight with Israeli forces at the Gaza border kills dozens of unarmed Palestinians and wounds hundreds.
articles.abstract: A lopsided fight with Israeli forces at the Gaza border kills dozens of unarmed Palestinians and wounds hundreds.
articles.lead_paragraph: GAZA — He crawled along the bumpy ground, wire-cutters in hand. People around him were felled by bullets. He choked when Israeli jeeps sped past, peppering him with tear gas. A few yards away, a man was shot in the leg. Behind him, he said, a teenage boy was shot in the head, fatally.

articles.headline: Please, Please Buy This Gun Company
articles.snippet: Big banks, private equity firms and national retailers that have vowed to operate with a social conscience could band together to turn Remington into the model of a modern gun company.
articles.abstract: Big banks, private equity firms and national retailers that have vowed to operate with a social conscience could band together to turn Remington into the model of a modern gun company.
articles.lead_paragraph: Remington Outdoor, one of the country’s oldest and largest gun makers, is getting ready to emerge from bankruptcy.

articles.headline: Killings in Gaza, New Embassy in Jerusalem, and Peace as Distant as Ever
articles.snippet: At least 60 Palestinian protesters are killed in Gaza, as the U.S. opens a new embassy 40 miles away.
articles.abstract: At least 60 Palestinian protesters are killed in Gaza, as the U.S. opens a new embassy 40 miles away.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Across the Gaza Strip on Monday morning, loudspeakers on minarets urged Palestinians to rush the fence bordering Israel, where they were met by army snipers. At least 60 were killed and thousands injured, local officials said — the worst day of carnage there since Israel invaded Gaza in 2014.

articles.headline: Shell Spreads Its Bets Around as It Prepares for a Greener Future
articles.snippet: Royal Dutch Shell’s acquisition of a small British energy firm shows how the world’s oil giants are navigating a shift away from their core products.
articles.abstract: Royal Dutch Shell’s acquisition of a small British energy firm shows how the world’s oil giants are navigating a shift away from their core products.
articles.lead_paragraph: COVENTRY, England — There seems to be little about the scrappy energy company in central England that would appeal to Royal Dutch Shell, the button-down oil giant.

articles.headline: For Meghan Markle’s American Family, a Relentless U.K. Glare
articles.snippet: Ms. Markle’s father, in particular, has been the focus of a litany of unflattering tabloid reports. The latest: He may not attend the wedding at all.
articles.abstract: Ms. Markle’s father, in particular, has been the focus of a litany of unflattering tabloid reports. The latest: He may not attend the wedding at all.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is notoriously hard to escape your background in Britain, no matter how successful you are or how much your life has diverged from that of your relatives. And so the British tabloids have for some months been treating the family of Meghan Markle, the American actress who is to marry Prince Harry on Saturday, like the stars of some sort of reality show: The Real Dysfunctional Families of America.
